meanings.definition: To mark or set boundaries or limits
meanings.sent1: She was demarking the garden with colorful stones.
meanings.sent2: The construction worker was demarking the road with bright paint.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it was demarking its territory by scratching the sofa.
meanings.sent4: His demarking of personal space was as clear as drawing a line in the sand.
meanings.sent5: The demarking of the finish line made the race more exciting.

meanings.definition: To distinguish or separate from others
meanings.sent1: The chef was demarking the ingredients for the recipe.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was demarking the correct answers from the wrong ones.
meanings.sent3: The detective demarked the suspect from the crowd with ease.
meanings.sent4: Her unique style demarked her as a trendsetter in the fashion industry.
meanings.sent5: The demarking of the rare species was crucial for conservation efforts.
